abstract.para: &app; is an enhanced gettext po file editor for the GNOME desktop environment.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &app; offers you a comfortable graphical interface to edit gettext po files. It allows you to easily navigate among fuzzy, translated and untranslated messages and has a status bar displaying the number of messages for each category.

&app; features opening and editing some PO files at the same time including to manage their headers, seeing the developer's information for each message (comments, context) and set new personal comments.

The profiles function allows you to have different accounts with the necessary information to fill the header. The option use my options to complete the following entries in the edit header dialog takes the information from the active profile in order to fill the header values.
The new system of translation memories let you use your own translated PO files in order to create a database that will offer you possible options to translate the current message.

&app; provide a plugin system which makes it easily extending. It include some useful plugins such as svn plugin in order to do the checkouts from the repository and commit the new translations. There are also plugins to visualize the source code where a message is, search in translation memories web services like Open Tran...

sect1.title: Using &app;
sect1.para: &app; is a full featured graphical environment that makes it possible to translate po files painlessly. This section describes basic usage of &app;.

sect2.title: Basic usage
sect2.para: Starting &app; opens the Main window.

The Main window is divided into three main area:
The menubar allows you the access the application menu.
The toolbar allow you quick access to frequently used file management, navigation and compile functions.
The workspace allows you to visualize and edit the messages contained in the po file. This area on its part is divided in another three. On the top is the message area with all messages of the PO file and its state. Under the message area, on the left is where it's showed the original message and the box where write the translation. Finally, on the right there is a panel with auxiliar information to help in the translation process.

sect3.title: Configuration
sect3.para:
&app; settings can be modified by choosing
Edit Preferences
menuitem.

sect3.title: Loading a po file
sect3.para:
To load a po file, use the
File Open
menuitem. It will bring up the Open file for translation dialog box. Browse through your computer filesystem, choose the po file you wish to open and click OK.

sect3.title: Editing po file
sect3.para:
The message area show all the messages in the PO file and their state. It is possible going to one specific message by clicking on it directly. You can also move through the messages with the buttons in the toolbar: forward and back. In the menu using
Go next fuzzy
and
GO previous fuzzy
it is possible moving directly among fuzzy messages and using
Go next untranslated
and
GO previous untranslated
it is possible moving directly among untranslated messages.

sect3.title: Saving po file
sect3.para: When a PO file has been modified (in a message or in the header) a * appears before its name in the window title or in the tab if you are editing some PO files at the same time.
If you close the PO file at this moment, then, the close dialog will be showed to you with this aspect:

sect2.title: Advanced features
sect2.para: &app; offeres to translator many features in order to do the translation process easier and confortable.

sect3.title: Profiles
sect3.para: The profiles feature provides to translator the possibility of having differents accounts with the basic information about herself and the language.

At the same time there is only one profile active. You can choose in a easy way through the preferences which is this profile. When you save a PO file and you have activated the option use my options to complete the following entries in the header dialog, &app; will fill this fields with the information in the active profile.

sect3.title: Translation Memory
sect3.para: The translation memory let you reuse the translations. It is a database that contains messages and their correspondent translatation for a specific language.

&app; offers the possibility of creating translation memories in two different ways. You can create the translation memory from a directory that contains PO files (see ). The program will create also a new entry in the translation memory each time that you translate a new message.
The level column show you in percentage how much the option coincide with the original message. The options are ordering by level.

sect2.title: Toolbar
sect2.para: The toolbar provides access to several commonly used routines. It is easily customizable. You can add or remove buttons as follow:

Go to
Edit Toolbar . The next dialog it will be showed you:
You can add or remove buttons just drag and drop them between the toolbar and the toolbar editor.

sect3.title: File management buttons in the toolbar
sect3.para: The file management buttons lets you access frequently used file management funcions quickly.

sect2.title: Menu Bar
sect2.para: The menu bar, located at the top of the Main Window, contains the following menus:

listitem.para:

ControlO
Open
This opens a po file.
Recent Files
This shows a list of your recently opened po files.
CtrlS
Save
This saves your file.
CtrlShiftS
Save as...
This saves your po file under a different name.
CtrlW
Close
This closes your file.
CtrlQ
Exit
This quits the application.
This menu contains:

CtrlZ
Undo
This undoes your last change.

CtrlX
Cut
This removes any text or data which is selected and places it in the buffer.

CtrlC
Copy
This copies any text or data which is selected into the buffer.

CtrlV
Paste
This pastes any text or data which is copied into the buffer.

Clear
This removes the selected text.
Header This opens a dialog box which allows you to edit information stored in the po file header.
Comment This allows to write a comment associates to one message.

CtrlSpace
Copy Message to Translation
This pastes the text from the original message in the translated message.

CtrlU

This set the current message to fuzzy.
Translation memory This shows the options in the translation memory for the current message.

Preferences This opens the Preferences dialog.
